subject: PHYSICS
content:
A material with a negative index of refraction has which of the
following technologically significant implications:
W) allowing imaging at resolutions below the diffraction limit of light
X) superluminal light
Y) improved spin coherence times
Z) realization of high temperature superconductors
answer:
W) ALLOWING IMAGING AT RESOLUTIONS BELOW THE DIFFRACTION
LIMIT OF LIGHT

subject: PHYSICS
content:
The experimental technique of x-ray diffraction would be
inappropriate for obtaining which of the following physical parameters of a material:
W) periodicity of a quantum well structure
X) the atomic spacing of a crystal lattice
Y) the amount of strain in a crystal lattice
Z) impurity concentration in an unknown crystalline sample
answer: Z) IMPURITY CONCENTRATION IN AN UNKOWN CRYSTALLINE SAMPLE

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
What is the electronic pair geometry and the molecular
geometry typical of the molecule with the general formula AB U, where A represents the central
4
atom, B represent the bonded atoms, and U represent the unbonded electron pair:
W) tetrahedral and angular
X) trigonal bipyramidal and seesaw
Y) octahedral and square pyramidal
Z) octahedral and square planar

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Give the net ionic equation that occurs when aqueous solutions of
ammonium sulfate and barium nitrate are mixed:

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What elemental ion is MOST commonly excreted in large amounts if
the human adrenals are producing low levels of corticosteroid?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
If a person had low levels of corticosteroid, which of the following
would be the BEST way to test whether the adrenal glands themselves are not functioning or if it is
the fault of the pituitary gland:
W) monitor the kidney for sodium excretion
X) measure the blood plasma for high levels of potassium
Y) inject small amounts of corticotropin and find if the adrenals produce corticosteroids
Z) monitor the urine for high amounts of protein and sodium
answer:
Y) INJECT SMALL AMOUNTS OF CORTICOTROPIN AND FIND IF THE
ADRENALS PRODUCE CORTICOSTEROIDS

subject: MATH
content:
Solve the following trigonometric equation for x, giving your answer in
radians such that 0 ≤ x < 2π: sin2 x + sin x – 2 = 0
π

subject: MATH
content:
Simplify the following trigonometric expression completely:
secθ−cosθ
tanθ

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following BEST describes a fold in a layered
rock that arches into a downward, trough-shaped fold:
W) anticline
X) graben
Y) heterocline
Z) syncline

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following statements is NOT true about tides:
W) tidal range is not the same over a whole ocean basin
X) tidal ranges generally increase with increasing distance from amphidromic points
Y) tidal bores are true tidal waves
Z) on average, tidal currents reach maximum velocity during flood current
answer:
Z) ON AVERAGE, TIDAL CURRENTS REACH MAXIMUM VELOCITY DURING
FLOOD CURRENT

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
In Africa it is estimated that about 200 million people are
infected with what water-borne parasitic disease known as Bilharzia?

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
A steroid will dissolve BEST in which of the following:
W) acetone
X) 50% ethanol
Y) 95% ethanol
Z) distilled water

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following is the BEST explanation of why
Population One stars have a high metal content:
W) old stars lose their metals as they age
X) old stars convert their metals to non-metals
Y) young stars acquire metals when they form from previous stars that created the metals
Z) all stars accumulate metals early in their development
answer:
Y) YOUNG STARS ACQUIRE METALS WHEN THEY FORM FROM PREVIOUS
STARS THAT CREATED THE METALS

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following is the BEST description of the
composition of our Sun:
W) 71% hydrogen, 27% helium, and 2% other
X) 80% hydrogen, 19% helium, and 1% other
Y) 90% hydrogen, 9% helium, and 1% other
Z) 99% hydrogen, 1% helium

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Consider an electrician who is about to drill holes though a series of
2-inch by 10-inch by 16-foot floor joists that are supported only at their ends by walls. Which of the
following hole locations would DECREASE the load strength of each joist the LEAST:
W) 7 feet in from one of the supporting walls near the bottom edge
X) 7 feet from one of the supporting walls near the top edge
Y) 1 foot from one of the supporting walls near the bottom edge
Z) 1 foot from one of the supporting walls half way down from the top edge
answer:
Z) 1 FOOT FROM ONE OF THE SUPPORTING WALLS HALF WAY DOWN
FROM THE TOP EDGE

subject: PHYSICS
content:
A metal alloy beam 10-meters long expands in length at 0.25% per
kelvin at temperatures about room temperature. If the beam is heated from 0ºC to 30ºC, how many
centimeters will it increase in length?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Phenylalanine (read as: FEE-nal-AL-ah-neen) is converted into
which of the following amino acids by the enzyme phenylalanine hydroxylase:
W) tyrosine
X) tryptophan
Y) threonine
Z) methionine

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
In the equation for the Gibbs free energy change, if ∆H (read as:
delta H) is positive and ∆S (read as: delta S) is positive, then the reactions are:
W) product-favored only at high temperatures
X) product-favored only at low temperatures
Y) product-favored at all temperatures
Z) reactant-favored at all temperatures
answer: W) PRODUCT-FAVORED ONLY AT HIGH TEMPERATURES

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following would most hematologists agree is the
MOST likely reason mammalian erythrocytes contain no nuclei or mitochondria:
W) to prevent oxidation of hemoglobin
X) to allow for more hemoglobin molecules per red blood cell
Y) to limit the lifespan of the red cell to 120 days
Z) to allow it to retain its bi-concave shape
answer:
X) TO ALLOW FOR MORE HEMOGLOBIN MOLECULES PER RED BLOOD
CELL

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What molecule in the lac operon exerts its control by inactivating the
repressor?

subject: MATH
content:
Giving your answer in standard form, give the equation of a circle with
center at (12, 7) and a radius of 4:

subject: MATH
content:
Find every value of k such that the following equation has exactly one
real number root: 16x2 + kx + 9 = 0

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following BEST describes the dynamics of a
typical alpine glacier:
W) the relative position of particles within the ice remains stationary
X) retreating glaciers carve out V-shaped valleys
Y) high pressures created by the mass movement of ice can produce meltwater deep within a glacier
Z) they move downhill primarily under the influence of ice avalanching
answer:
Y) HIGH PRESSURES CREATED BY THE MASS MOVEMENT OF ICE CAN
PRODUCE MELTWATER DEEP WITHIN A GLACIER

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following BEST describes winds that form
when the Sun sets atop a mountain and, since the air is cooler at the top, it flows down the mountain
side into the valley:
W) chinook
X) katabatic
Y) geostrophic
Z) Ekman spirals

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
Consider a pond that has high amounts of phosphorus
and nitrogen. The pond shows signs of large amounts of algae. This pond would most likely be
considered:
W) anticlinic
X) oligotrophic (read as: oh-lig-oh-tro-fick)
Y) synclinic
Z) eutrophic

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
The galvanic series typically lists metals in which of
the following orders:
W) cathodic versus anodic
X) passive versus reactive
Y) pure metal versus alloy
Z) lowest to highest electrode potential

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following is the BEST reason why the Sun’s
corona primarily emits x-rays:
W) it has a high-strength magnetic field
X) it is where most of the neutrinos escape to outer space
Y) it is a convecting zone
Z) it is very hot

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following is a spacecraft that is stationed to
continuously observe the Sun:
W) Chandra
X) Hubble
Y) SOHO (read as: so-ho)
Z) Galileo 3

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
What is the name of the hybrid super computer in
Yokohama, Japan, specifically designed for atmospheric modeling calculations?

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following BEST describes the field of
study called spintronics:
W) studying the angular momentum of celestial bodies
X) using high strength centripetal forces to separate materials in solution
Y) nanoscale electronics that involve manipulation and observation of electron spin
Z) quantum manipulation of quark and gluon spin states
answer:
Y) NANOSCALE ELECTRONICS THAT INVOLVE MANIPULATION AND
OBSERVATION OF ELECTRON SPIN

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following will NOT produce a precipitate after
the two aqueous solutions are mixed:
W) barium chloride and sodium sulfate
X) lead nitrate and sodium chloride
Y) sodium bromide and rubidium chloride
Z) mercury one nitrate and calcium chloride
answer: Y) SODIUM BROMIDE AND RUBIDIUM CHLORIDE

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following is NOT an example of a weak base:
W) NH
3
X) NH +
4
Y) CH NH
3 2
Z) C H NH
6 5 2

subject: MATH
content:
Giving your answer as a circle, parabola, ellipse, or hyperbola, if a conic
section has an eccentricity that is 0.333, what type is it?

subject: MATH
content:
Give the center and radius of the following equation of a circle:
x2 + y2 + 8x – 2y + 13 = 0

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Which of the following BEST explains how a linear accelerator
speeds up charged particles:
W) creating large electric fields that push particles along on electromagnetic waves
X) using magnets to push them along their trajectories
Y) using superconducting magnets to accelerate particles to near light speed
Z) using synchrotron radiation to ionize particles which are then accelerated by superconducting
magnets
answer:
W) CREATING LARGE ELECTRIC FIELDS THAT PUSH PARTICLES ALONG
ON ELECTROMAGNETIC WAVES

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Particle accelerators used by physicists are generally linear or
circular. Which of the following is a major advantage of linear designs over circular:
W) high energy electrons can only be obtained in linear accelerators
X) linear accelerators do not need the large, expensive magnets of circular accelerators and do not
have as much radiation loss
Y) they typically can produce more chances for collisions because they use fixed targets
Z) they can be used in fixed target experiments while circular accelerators cannot
answer:
X) LINEAR ACCELERATORS DO NOT NEED THE LARGE, EXPENSIVE
MAGNETS OF CIRCULAR ACCELERATORS AND DO NOT HAVE AS MUCH RADIATION
LOSS

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
Which of the following probably originated in the Jurassic
Period from thecodonts or early theropod dinosaurs:
W) ammonoids
X) marsupials
Y) proboscidians
Z) birds

subject: EARTH SCIENCE
content:
In soil taxonomy, which of the following is a leached
acidic soil rich in iron oxides and aluminum and typically found in the Eastern U.S. and Canada
under forest landscapes:
W) pedocals
X) pedalfers
Y) particulites
Z) laterites

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following is the most effective allosteric inhibitor of
enzymes such as phosphofructokinase (read as: phos-foe-FRUCK-toe-kynase), in glycolysis:
W) ADP
X) ATP
Y) cyclic AMP
Z) NAD+

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
In a human heart, if the end diastolic volume is a constant 30 cubic
centimeters and the heart rate is a constant 60 beats per minute, what is the cardiac output, in
milliliters, if the stroke volume is 80 milliliters?

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
In what region of the electromagnetic spectrum is a supernova
most commonly detected?

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
What are the 3 general layers of the Sun’s atmosphere from
INNERMOST to OUTERMOST?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
What are the respective frequencies of the second and third harmonics
of a string with a fundamental frequency of 262 hertz?

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Assuming that they roll without sliding, order the following 3 objects
from the one with the SMALLEST rotational velocity down an arbitrarily long inclined plane to the
one with the LARGEST, after 5 seconds: a one-inch-diameter o-ring; a three-quarter inch-diameter
marble; a quarter
answer:
A ONE-INCH-DIAMETER O-RING; A QUARTER; A THREE-QUARTER INCH-
DIAMETER MARBLE

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
What rule states that electrons occupy all the orbitals of a given
subshell singly before pairing begins and that these unpaired electrons have parallel spins?
answer: HUND’S RULE (ACCEPT: HUND’S RULE OF MAXIMUM MULTIPLICITY)

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Knowing that gallium is in group 13 and Period 4, give the
simplified ground-state electron configuration, starting with the last filled noble gas configuration of
argon:

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
A tetrad in prophase one of meiosis has how many chromosomes and
chromatids, respectively?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
In beta oxidation of fats, long-chain hydrocarbon fatty acids feed
into the Krebs cycle most commonly via what central molecule of glucose metabolism?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content: What is the only amino acid that is not optically active?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Consider two tanks that are connected by a closed valve. Tank A
contains 6 liters of nitrogen gas at a pressure of 24 atmospheres and tank B contains 2 liters of
oxygen gas at a pressure of 16 atmospheres. If the temperature is constant and the valve is opened,
what is the pressure, in atmospheres, of the gas mixture at equilibrium?
answer:
22
(Solution: P V = P V ; (24atm)(6L) = (P )(8L) = 18atm; (16atm)(2L) = (P )(8L) = 4atm; P
1 1 2 2 N2 O2 total
= 18 + 4 = 22atm)
